1.verse_text: The proverbs of Solomon, King David"s son, from Israel: to help one understand wise sayings. which is righteous, just, and full of integrity. the young knowledgeable and discreet. those with understanding gain guidance. the words of the wise, and their puzzles. but fools despise wisdom and instruction. don"t neglect your mother"s teaching; and beads for your neck. Don"t go 'Come with us. Let"s set up a deadly ambush. Let"s secretly wait for the innocent just for fun. whole, like those who go down into the pit. we"ll fill our houses with plunder. we"ll share our money.' keep your feet from their way, they hurry to spill blood. in the sight of a bird. they lie in wait for their own lives. it costs them their lives. in the public square she raises her voice. At the entrances of the city gates, she has her say: mockers hold their mocking dear, and fools hate knowledge? Look, I"ll pour out my spirit on you. I"ll reveal my words to you. I stretched out my hand to you, but you paid no attention. and you didn"t want me to correct you. I"ll make fun of you when dread comes over you, and your disaster comes in like a tornado, when distress and oppression overcome you. they will seek me, but won"t find me and didn"t choose the fear of the LORD . they rejected all my corrections. and they"ll be full of their own schemes. smugness will destroy fools. untroubled by the dread of harm.'
Their purpose is to teach wisdom and discipline,
They provide insightful instruction,
They make the naive mature,
The wise hear them and grow in wisdom;
They help one understand proverbs and difficult sayings,
Wisdom begins with the fear of the LORD ,
Listen, my son, to your father"s instruction;
for they are a graceful wreath on your head,
My son, don"t let sinners entice you.
when they say:
Let"s swallow up the living like the grave –
We"ll find all sorts of precious wealth;
Throw in your lot with us;
My son, don"t go on the path with them;
because their feet run to evil;
It"s useless to cast a net
But these sinners set up a deadly ambush;
These are the ways of all who seek unjust gain;
Wisdom shouts in the street;
Above the noisy crowd, she calls out.
'How long will you clueless people love your naÃ¯vetÃ©,
You should respond when I correct you.
I invited you, but you rejected me;
You ignored all my advice,
So I"ll laugh at your disaster;
when terror hits you like a hurricane,
Then they will call me, but I won"t answer;
because they hated knowledge
They didn"t want my advice;
They will eat from the fruit of their way,
The immature will die because they turn away;
Those who obey me will dwell securely,

2.verse_text: My son, accept my words and store up my commands. and stretch your mind toward understanding. and cry aloud for understanding. search for it like hidden treasure. and discover the knowledge of God. from his mouth come knowledge and understanding. He is a shield for those who live a blameless life. and guards the way of those who are loyal to him. as well as integrity, every good course. and knowledge will fill you with delight. understanding will protect you. from people who twist their words. and go on obscure paths. rejoicing in their twisted evil. they get lost on their way. from the foreign woman with her slick words. she even forgets her covenant with God. and her paths go down to the shadowy dead. they will never again reach the ways of the living. guarding the road of the righteous. the innocent will remain in it. and the treacherous will be ripped up.
Turn your ear toward wisdom,
Call out for insight,
Seek it like silver;
Then you will understand the fear of the LORD ,
The LORD gives wisdom;
He reserves ability for those with integrity.
He protects the paths of justice
Then you will understand righteousness and justice,
Wisdom will enter your mind,
Discretion will guard you;
Wisdom will rescue you from the evil path,
They forsake the way of integrity
They enjoy doing evil,
Their paths are confused;
Wisdom will rescue you from the mysterious woman,
She leaves behind the partner of her youth;
Her house sinks down to death,
All those who go to her will never return;
So you should stay on the path of good people,
Those who have integrity will dwell in the land;
But the wicked will be cut off from the land,

3.verse_text: My son, don"t forget my instruction. Let your heart guard my commands, and provide you with well-being. Bind them on your neck; write them on the tablet of your heart. in the eyes of God and humanity. don"t rely on your own intelligence. and he will keep your ways straight. Fear the LORD and turn away from evil. and your bones strengthened. and with the first of all your crops. and your vats will burst with wine. don"t despise his correction. just like a father who treats his son with favor. and those who gain understanding. and her gain better than gold. all you desire can"t compare with her. in her left are wealth and honor. all her paths are peaceful. those who hold her tight are happy. establishing the heavens with understanding. and the skies drop dew. hold on to sound judgment and discretion. and an ornament for your neck. and your foot won"t stumble. When you lie down, your sleep will be pleasant. or the ruin that comes to the wicked. he will guard your feet from being snared. when it is in your power to do so. I"ll give it to you tomorrow,' when you have it. who trusts and lives near you. when they haven"t harmed you. or choose any of their ways. but the virtuous are his close friends. but he blesses the home of the righteous. but he shows favor to the humble. but fools receive shame.
because they will help you live a long time
Don"t let loyalty and faithfulness leave you.
Then you will find favor and approval
Trust in the LORD with all your heart;
Know him in all your paths,
Don"t consider yourself wise.
Then your body will be healthy
Honor the LORD with your wealth
Then your barns will be filled with plenty,
Don"t reject the instruction of the LORD , my son;
The LORD loves those he corrects,
Happy are those who find wisdom
Her profit is better than silver,
Her value exceeds pearls;
In her right hand is a long life;
Her ways are pleasant;
She is a tree of life to those who embrace her;
The LORD laid the foundations of the earth with wisdom,
With his knowledge, the watery depths burst open,
My son, don"t let them slip from your eyes;
They will be life for your whole being,
Then you will walk safely on your path,
If you lie down, you won"t be terrified.
Don"t fear sudden terror
The LORD will be your confidence;
Don"t withhold good from someone who deserves it,
Don"t say to your neighbor, 'Go and come back;
Don"t plan to harm your neighbor
Don"t accuse anyone without reason,
Don"t envy violent people
Devious people are detestable to the LORD ,
The LORD "s curse is on the house of the wicked,
He mocks mockers,
The wise gain respect,

4.verse_text: Hear, children, fatherly instruction; pay attention to gain understanding. Don"t abandon my instruction. tender and my mother"s favorite, 'Let your heart hold on to my words: Keep my commands and live. Don"t forget and don"t turn away from my words. Love her, and she will protect you. Get wisdom! Get understanding before anything else. She will honor you if you embrace her. she will give you a glorious crown.' then the years of your life will be many. I lead you in straight courses. when you run, you won"t stumble. protect it, for it is your life. don"t walk on the path of evil people. stay off of it and keep going! they are robbed of sleep unless they make someone stumble. and they drink the wine of violence. that gets brighter and brighter till it is full day. they don"t know where they will stumble. Bend your ear to my speech. Guard them in your mind. and healing for their entire body. keep devious lips far from you. keep your gaze on what is in front of you. and all your paths will be secure. turn your feet away from evil.
I"ll teach you well.
When I was a son to my father,
he taught me and said to me:
Get wisdom; get understanding.
Don"t abandon her, and she will guard you.
The beginning of wisdom:
Highly esteem her, and she will exalt you.
She will place a graceful wreath on your head;
Listen, my son, and take in my speech,
I teach you the path of wisdom.
When you walk, you won"t be hindered;
Hold on to instruction; don"t slack off;
Don"t go on the way of the wicked;
Avoid it! Don"t turn onto it;
They don"t sleep unless they do evil;
They eat the bread of evil,
The way of the righteous is like morning light
The path of the wicked is like deep darkness;
My son, pay attention to my words.
Don"t let them slip from your sight.
They are life to those who find them,
More than anything you guard, protect your mind, for life flows from it.
Have nothing to do with a corrupt mouth;
Focus your eyes straight ahead;
Watch your feet on the way,
Don"t deviate a bit to the right or the left;

5.verse_text: My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Bend your ear to what I know, and your lips might guard knowledge. and her tongue is smoother than oil, sharp as a double-edged sword. Her paths wander, but she doesn"t know it. and don"t deviate from the words of my mouth. don"t approach the entrance to her house. your years to a cruel person. and your hard work will end up in a foreigner"s house. when your body and flesh are exhausted, How my heart despised correction! I didn"t obey my teacher. in the assembled community.' gushing water from your own well. streams of water in the public squares? not for you as well as strangers. Rejoice in the wife of your youth. Let her breasts intoxicate you all the time; always be drunk on her love. and embrace the breasts of a foreign female? observing all their ways. grabbed by the ropes of their own sin. misled by their own stupidity.
so you might remain discreet,
The lips of a mysterious woman drip honey,
but in the end she is bitter as gall,
Her feet go down to death; her steps lead to the grave.
She doesn"t stay on the way of life.
Now sons, listen to me,
Stay on a path that is far from her;
Otherwise, you will give your strength to others,
Otherwise, strangers will sap your strength,
You will groan at the end
and you say, 'How I hated instruction!
I didn"t listen to the voice of my instructor.
I"m on the brink of utter ruin
Drink water from your own cistern,
Should your fountains flood outside,
They are yours alone,
May your spring be blessed.
She is a lovely deer, a graceful doe.
Why, my son, should you lose your senses with a mysterious woman
The LORD "s eyes watch over every person"s path,
The wicked will be caught by their own evil acts,
Those without instruction will die,

6.verse_text: My son, if you guarantee a loan for your neighbor or shake hands in agreement with a stranger, you will be caught by your words. for you have come under the control of your neighbor. or slumber to your eyelids. like a bird from the hand of a fowler. observe its ways and grow wise. gathers its provisions at harvest. When will you rise from your sleep? a little folding of the arms to lie down– destitution like a warrior. go around with crooked talk. and point with their fingers. they create controversies all the time. they will be quickly broken beyond healing. seven things detestable to him: a lying tongue, hands that spill innocent blood, feet that run quickly to evil, and one who causes conflicts among relatives. don"t abandon your mother"s instruction. fasten them around your neck. when you lie down, they will protect you; when you awake, they will occupy your attention. corrective teaching is the path of life. from the flattering tongue of the foreign woman. don"t let her take you in with her eyelashes, but a married woman hunts for a man"s very life. and his clothes not get burned? don"t his feet get burned? anyone who touches her will be punished. to fill his starving stomach. he must give all the riches of his house. Doing so, he destroys himself. His shame will never be wiped away. he"ll show no mercy on his day of revenge. he"ll refuse even a large bribe.
you will be trapped by your words;
Do this, my son, to get out of it, So go, humble yourself, and pester your neighbor.
Don"t give sleep to your eyes
Get yourself free like a gazelle from a hunter,
Go to the ant, you lazy person;
The ant has no commander, officer, or ruler.
Even so, it gets its food in summer;
How long, lazy person, will you lie down?
A little sleep, a little slumber,
and poverty will come on you like a prowler,
Worthless people and guilty people
They wink their eyes, gesture with their feet,
Their hearts are corrupt and determined to do evil;
Therefore, sudden disaster will come upon them;
There are six things that the LORD hates,
snobbish eyes,
a heart set on wicked plans,
a false witness who breathes lies,
My son, keep your father"s command;
Bind them on your heart for all time;
When you walk around, they will lead you;
The commandment is a lamp and instruction a light;
They guard you from the evil woman,
Don"t desire her beauty in secret;
for a prostitute costs a loaf of bread,
Can a man scoop fire into his lap
If a man walks on hot coals,
So is the man who approaches his neighbor"s wife;
People don"t despise a thief if he steals
But if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold;
He who commits adultery is senseless.
He is wounded and disgraced.
Jealousy makes a man rage;
He won"t accept compensation;

7.verse_text: My son, keep my words; store up my commands within you. and my instruction like the pupil of your eye. write them on the tablet of your heart. call understanding 'friend,' from the foreign woman who flatters you. from behind the screen, I gazed down, and noticed among the youth, one who had no sense. and walked down the path to her house at the onset of night and darkness. dressed like a prostitute and with a cunning mind. her feet don"t stay long in her own house. She lies in wait at every corner. Her face is brazen as she speaks to him: today I fulfilled my solemn promises. seeking you, and I have found you. with colored linens from Egypt. aloes, and cinnamon. let"s savor our lovemaking. he"s gone far away. he won"t come home till full moon.' She entices him with her flattery. like an ox to the slaughter, like a bird hurrying to the snare, not aware that it will cost him his life. and pay attention to my speech. don"t wander down her paths. she has killed many people. going down to the chambers of death.
Keep my commands and live,
Bind them on your fingers;
Say to wisdom, 'You are my sister';
so she might guard you against the mysterious woman,
When from the window of my house,
I looked among the naive young men
He was crossing the street at her corner
in the early evening,
All of a sudden a woman approaches him,
She is noisy and defiant;
She has one foot in the street, one foot in the public square.
She grabs him and kisses him.
'I"ve made a sacrifice of well-being;
So I"ve come out to meet you,
I"ve spread my bed with luxurious covers,
I"ve sprinkled my bed with myrrh,
Come, let"s drink deep of love until morning;
For my husband isn"t home;
He took a pouch of money with him;
She seduces him with all her talk.
He goes headlong after her, like a deer leaping into a trap,
until an arrow pierces his liver,
Now sons, listen to me,
Don"t turn your heart to her ways;
She has caused many corpses to fall;
Her house is a path to the grave,

8.verse_text: Doesn"t Wisdom cry out and Understanding shout? at the crossroads she takes her stand. at the entrances she shouts: my voice goes out to all of humanity. Take this to heart, you fools. from my lips comes what is right. my lips despise wickedness. nothing in them is twisted or crooked. and upright for the knowledgeable. knowledge rather than choice gold. nothing is more delightful than she. I have found knowledge and discretion. I hate pride and arrogance, the path of evil and corrupt speech. as well as understanding and strength. and princes issue righteous decrees. those who seek me will find me. as well as enduring wealth and righteousness. my crops are better than choice silver. on the paths of justice, and to fill up their treasuries. before his deeds long in the past. at the beginning, before the earth was. when there were no springs flowing with water. before the hills, I was brought forth; or the first of the dry land. when he marked out the horizon on the deep sea, when he secured the fountains of the deep, so the water couldn"t go beyond his command, when he marked out the earth"s foundations. I was having fun, smiling before him all the time, and delighting in the human race. Happy are those who keep to my ways! don"t avoid it. watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorposts. they gain favor from the LORD . all those who hate me love death.
Atop the heights along the path,
By the gate before the city,
I cry out to you, people;
Understand skill, you who are naive.
Listen, for I speak things that are correct;
My mouth utters the truth;
All the words of my mouth are righteous;
All of them are straightforward to those who understand,
Take my instruction rather than silver,
Wisdom is better than pearls;
I, Wisdom, dwell with prudence;
To fear the LORD is to hate evil.
I have advice and ability,
By me kings rule,
By me rulers govern, and officials judge righteously.
I love those who love me;
Riches and honor are with me,
My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold;
I walk on the way of righteousness,
to provide for those who love me
The LORD created me at the beginning of his way,
I was formed in ancient times,
When there were no watery depths, I was brought forth,
Before the mountains were settled,
before God made the earth and the fields
I was there when he established the heavens,
when he thickened the clouds above,
when he set a limit for the sea,
I was beside him as a master of crafts.
frolicking with his inhabited earth
Now children, listen to me:
Listen to instruction, and be wise;
Happy are those who listen to me,
Those who find me find life;
Those who offend me injure themselves;

9.verse_text: Wisdom built her house; she has carved out her seven pillars. mixed her wine, and set her table. from the top of the city heights: she says to those who lack sense. and drink the wine I have mixed. walk in the way of understanding.' whoever corrects the wicked gets hurt. correct the wise, and they will love you. inform the righteous, and their learning will increase. the knowledge of the holy one is understanding. years will be added to your life. if you are cynical, you will bear it all alone. she"s stupid and doesn"t even know it. on a seat at the city heights. those going straight on their way. she says to those who lack sense. food eaten in secret is pleasant.'
She sends out her female servants; she issues an invitation
Abandon your simplistic ways and live;
Whoever instructs the cynic gets insulted;
Don"t correct the impudent, or they will hate you;
Teach the wise, and they will become wiser;
The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the LORD ;
Through me your days will be many;
If you are wise, it is to your benefit;
She sits at the doorway of her house,
She invites those who pass by on the path,
But they don"t know that the dead are there; her guests are in the depths of the grave.

10.verse_text: The proverbs of Solomon: A wise child makes a father glad, but a foolish child brings sorrow to his mother. but righteousness rescues people from death. but he rejects the desires of the wicked. hard work makes one rich. a disgraceful son sleeps right through the harvest. but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence. but the name of the wicked rots. but a foolish talker is ruined. but those on crooked paths will be found out. those who speak foolishly are ruined. but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence. but love covers all offenses. but there is a rod for the back of those with no sense. but the mouth of a fool brings on ruin. the ruin of the poor is their poverty. the earnings of the wicked lead to sin. but those who ignore correction lose their way. and those who spread slander are fools. but the wise restrain their lips. but the heart of the wicked lacks value. but fools who lack sense will die. and no trouble is added to it. but those with understanding take pleasure in wisdom. but what the righteous desire will be given to them. but the righteous stand firm forever. so are lazy people to those who authorize them. but the years of the wicked will be cut short. but the hopes of the wicked will perish. and ruin for those who do evil. but the wicked won"t dwell in the land. but the twisted tongue will be cut off. but the mouth of the wicked knows only what is perverse.
The treasure of the wicked won"t profit them,
The LORD doesn"t let the righteous starve,
Laziness brings poverty;
A wise son harvests in the summer;
Blessings cover the head of the righteous,
The memory of the righteous is a blessing,
The skilled mind accepts commands,
Those who walk in innocence walk with confidence,
Those who wink an eye bring trouble;
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
Hate stirs up conflict,
Wisdom is found on the lips of those who have understanding,
The wise store up knowledge,
The riches of the wealthy are their strong city;
The wages of the righteous lead to life;
Those who heed instruction are on the way to life,
Lying lips conceal hate,
With lots of words comes wrongdoing,
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver,
The lips of the righteous nourish many people,
The LORD "s blessing makes a person rich,
Fools enjoy vile deeds,
What the wicked dread will come on them,
After a whirlwind passes by, the wicked are no more,
Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
The fear of the LORD increases one"s life,
The expectations of the righteous result in joy,
The path of the LORD is a refuge for the innocent
The righteous will never be shaken,
The mouth of the righteous flows with wisdom,
The lips of the wise know what is acceptable,

11.verse_text: The LORD detests dishonest scales, but delights in an accurate weight. but wisdom brings humility. but dishonesty ruins the treacherous. but righteousness rescues from death. but the wicked fall in their wickedness. but the untrustworthy are caught by their own desires. Yes, any hope based on money perishes. and the wicked take their place. but the righteous are saved by their knowledge. when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy. it is destroyed by the words of the wicked. a sensible person keeps quiet. but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence. but there is victory with many counselors. but the one who refuses to shake hands will be secure. violent men gain only wealth. but cruel people harm themselves. but those who sow righteousness receive a true reward. but those who pursue evil, toward death. but he favors those whose path is innocent. but the children of the righteous will escape. is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion. but the expectations of the wicked bring wrath. but those who are stingy with what is appropriate will grow needy. those who refresh others will themselves be refreshed. but those who seek evil–it will come to them. but the righteous will thrive like leafy trees. The fool will be servant to the wise. how much more the wicked and sinners?
When pride comes, so does shame,
Integrity guides the virtuous,
Riches don"t help in the day of wrath,
The righteousness of the innocent makes their path straight,
Those who do right are saved by their righteousness,
When the wicked die, their hope perishes.
The righteous are saved from distress,
The godless destroy their neighbors by their words,
When the righteous succeed, a city rejoices;
A city is honored by the blessing of the virtuous;
Whoever despises their neighbor lacks sense;
A slanderer walks around revealing secrets,
Without guidance, a people will fall,
Guaranteeing the debt of a stranger brings big trouble,
A gracious woman gains honor;
Kind persons benefit themselves,
The wicked earn false wages,
The righteous are headed toward life,
The LORD detests a crooked heart,
The evil person will surely not go unpunished,
Like a gold ring in a pig"s nose
The desires of the righteous end up well,
Those who give generously receive more,
Generous persons will prosper;
People curse those who hoard grain, but they bless those who sell it. and the wise gather lives.
Those who look for good find favor,
Those who trust in their wealth will wither,
Those who trouble their family will inherit the wind.
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
If the righteous receive their due on earth,

12.verse_text: Those who love discipline love knowledge, and those who hate correction are stupid. but he condemns schemers. but the roots of the righteous can"t be disturbed. but a disgraceful woman is like rot in his bones. but the guidance of the wicked is deceptive. but the speech of those who do right rescues them. but the family of the righteous will endure. but a warped mind leads to contempt. than to be conceited and lack food. but even the compassion of the wicked is cruel. but those who engage in empty pursuits have no sense. but the righteous escape from distress. their work results in reward. but the wise listen to advice. but the shrewd hide their contempt. but a false witness deceives. but a wise tongue heals. but a lying tongue lasts only for a moment. but there is joy for those who advise peace. but the wicked receive their fill of trouble. he favors those who do what is true. but the heart of fools proclaims their stupidity. while a lazy one will be sentenced to hard labor. but a good word encourages. but the path of the wicked makes them wander. but hard workers receive precious riches.
The LORD favors good people,
No one is established by wicked acts,
A strong woman is a crown to her husband,
The plans of the righteous are just,
The words of the wicked are a deathtrap,
The wicked are destroyed and are no more,
A person is praised for his insight,
Better to be held in low regard and have a servant
The righteous care about their livestock"s needs,
Those who work their land will have plenty to eat,
Desiring evil is a trap for the wicked, but the root of the righteous endures. but the detestable path leads to death.
The wicked are trapped by the transgressions of their lips,
From the fruit of their speech, people are well satisfied;
Fools see their own way as right,
Fools reveal their anger right away,
Those who state the truth speak justly,
Some chatter on like a stabbing sword,
Truthful lips endure forever,
Deceit is in the heart of those who plan evil,
No harm happens to the righteous,
The LORD detests false lips;
The shrewd conceal their knowledge,
A hard worker is in charge,
Anxiety leads to depression,
The righteous offer guidance to their neighbors,
The lazy don"t roast their prey,
The way of the righteous leads to life,

13.verse_text: A wise son listens to the discipline of his father, but a mocker doesn"t listen to correction. but the treacherous have an appetite only for violence. but those who open their lips are ruined. the appetite of the diligent is satisfied. but the wicked create disgust and scorn. but wickedness misleads sinners. while others pretend to be poor, but have great riches. but the poor don"t even receive threats. but the lamp of the wicked goes out. those who take advice are wise. but those who acquire them gradually become wealthy. longing fulfilled is a tree of life. but those who respect the commandment will be rewarded. turning a person away from deathtraps. but fools display their stupidity. but a reliable one brings healing. honor belongs to those who heed correction. but fools find deviating from evil disgusting. befriend fools and get in trouble. but good things reward the righteous. but the wealth of sinners is stored up for the righteous. but it is unjustly swept away. but the one who loves them applies discipline. but the wicked have empty stomachs.
People eat well from the fruit of their words,
People who watch their mouths guard their lives,
The lazy have strong desires but receive nothing;
The righteous hate false words,
Righteousness guards the innocent on the path,
Some pretend to be rich but have nothing,
Wealth can ransom a person"s life,
The light of the righteous rejoices,
The empty-headed cause conflict out of pride;
Riches gotten quickly will dwindle,
Hope delayed makes the heart sick;
Trouble will come on those who despise a word,
The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
Good insight brings favor, but the way of the faithless is their ruin.
The prudent all act intelligently,
Wicked messengers fall into trouble,
Poverty and shame come to those who don"t care about instruction;
A desire fulfilled is pleasant,
Walk with wise people and become wise;
Trouble pursues sinners,
Good people leave their grandchildren an inheritance,
A poor person"s land might produce much food,
Those who withhold the rod hate their children,
The righteous eat their fill,

14.verse_text: A wise woman builds her house, while a foolish woman tears hers down with her own hands. but those who take a crooked path despise him. but the lips of the wise protect them. but when there is a strong bull, there is abundant produce. but a false witness spews lies. but knowledge comes quickly to the intelligent. for you won"t learn wise speech there. but the stupidity of fools deceives them. but favor is with those who do right. another person can"t share its joy. but the tent flourishes for those who do right. but in the end it is a path to death. and in the end, joy turns to sorrow. the good receive the due reward for their deeds. but the prudent give thought to their steps. but fools become excited and overconfident. and schemers are hated. but the prudent are crowned with knowledge. wicked people are at the gates of the righteous. but many love the wealthy. but happy are those who are kind to the needy. Those who plan good receive loyalty and faithfulness. but mere talk leads to poverty. and the folly of fools is folly. but a deceiver proclaims lies. and refuge for one"s children. turning people away from deathtraps. but a dwindling people is a ruler"s ruin. but impatience leads to stupid mistakes. but jealousy rots the bones. while those who are kind to the poor honor God. but the righteous find refuge even in death. but sin disgraces a people. but is furious at a shameful one.
Those who walk with integrity fear the LORD ,
Pride sprouts in the mouth of a fool,
When there are no oxen, the stall is clean,
A truthful witness doesn"t lie,
A mocker searches for wisdom and gets none,
Stay away from fools,
By their wisdom the prudent understand their way,
Fools mock a compensation offering,
The heart knows its own distress;
The house of the wicked is destroyed,
There is a path that may seem straight to someone,
The heart feels pain even in laughter,
Rebellious hearts receive satisfaction from their ways;
The naive believe anything,
The wise are careful and avoid evil,
Short-tempered people make stupid mistakes,
Stupidity is the lot of the naive,
Evil people will bow down before the good;
Even their neighbors hate the poor,
Those who despise their neighbors are sinners,
Don"t those who plan evil go astray?
There is profit in hard work,
Wealth is the crown of the wise,
A truthful witness saves lives,
In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence
The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life,
A king"s glory is a large population,
Patience leads to abundant understanding,
A peaceful mind gives life to the body,
Those who exploit the powerless anger their maker,
The wicked are thrown down by their own evil,
Wisdom resides in an understanding heart, but it"s not known in fools.
Righteousness dignifies a nation,
The king favors an insightful servant,

15.verse_text: A sensitive answer turns back wrath, but an offensive word stirs up anger. but the mouth of a fool gushes with stupidity. keeping watch on evil and good people. but dishonest talk breaks the spirit. but those who heed correction are mature. but the gain of the wicked brings trouble. but the hearts of fools have none. but favors the prayers of those who do right. but loves those who pursue righteousness. those who hate correction will die. how much more the hearts of human beings! They won"t go to the wise. but a troubled heart breaks the spirit. but fools feed on folly. but a happy heart has a continual feast. than a great treasure with turmoil. than a plump calf with hate. but patient people calm down strife. but the way of those who do right is a clear road. but fools despise their mothers. but those with understanding walk straight ahead. but with many counselors they succeed. how good is a word at the right time! but he preserves the widow"s boundaries. but gracious words are pure. but those who hate bribes will live. but the wicked mouth blurts out evil. but he listens to the prayers of the righteous. good news strengthens the bones. dwells among the wise. but those who listen to correction gain understanding. and humility comes before respect.
The tongue of the wise enhances knowledge,
The LORD "s eyes are everywhere,
Wholesome speech is a tree of life,
A fool doesn"t like a father"s instruction,
Great treasure is in the house of the righteous,
The lips of the wise spread knowledge,
The LORD detests the sacrifices of the wicked,
The LORD detests the path of the wicked,
Discipline is severe for those who abandon the way;
The grave and the underworld lie open before the LORD ;
Mockers don"t like those who correct them.
A joyful heart brightens one"s face,
An understanding heart seeks knowledge;
All the days of the needy are hard,
Better a little with fear of the LORD
Better a meal of greens with love
Hotheads stir up conflict,
The path of the lazy is like a hedge of thorns,
A wise child brings joy to a father,
Folly is joy to those who lack sense,
Plans fail with no counsel,
To give an appropriate answer is a joy;
For those with insight, life is an upward path, avoiding the grave below.
The LORD snatches away the arrogant one"s house,
The LORD detests evil plans,
Those who acquire things unjustly gain trouble for their house,
The righteous heart reflects before answering,
The LORD is far from the wicked,
Bright eyes give joy to the heart;
The ear that listens to life-giving correction
Those who refuse discipline despise themselves,
The fear of the LORD is wise instruction,

16.verse_text: To people belong the plans of the heart, but the answer of the tongue comes from the LORD . are pure in their eyes, but the LORD tests the motives. and your plans will succeed. even the wicked for an evil day. they surely won"t go unpunished. the fear of the LORD turns away evil. even their enemies are at peace with them. than great profits without justice. but the LORD secures their steps. in a judgment, one can"t go against his words. all the weights in the bag are his doing. for their thrones are founded on righteousness. they love words of integrity. the wise will calm him. His favor is like a cloud that brings spring rain. and acquiring understanding is better than silver. those who protect their path guard their lives. and arrogance before a fall. than to divide plunder with the proud. those who trust the LORD are blessed. and pleasant speech enhances teaching. but the instruction of the foolish is folly. and enhances the teaching of their lips. sweet to the taste and healing to the bones. but in the end it is the path of death. for their hunger presses them on. their lips are like a scorching fire. gossips alienate close friends. and walk them down a path that isn"t good. those who purse their lips plan evil. it is found on the path of righteousness. and better to have self-control than to capture a city. all decisions are from the LORD .
All the ways of people
Commit your work to the LORD ,
The LORD made everything for a purpose,
The LORD detests all who are arrogant;
Love and faithfulness reconcile guilt;
When people draw favor from the LORD ,
Better a little with righteousness
People plan their path,
A king"s speech is like an oracle;
Honest balances and scales are the LORD "s;
Kings detest wicked deeds,
Kings favor those with righteous lips;
The king"s anger is a messenger of death;
There"s life in the light of the king"s face.
Acquiring wisdom is much better than gold,
The road of those who do right turns away from evil;
Pride comes before disaster,
Better to be humble with the needy
Those with insight find prosperity;
The skilled mind is called discerning,
One who has insight is a fountain of life,
The mind of the wise makes their speech insightful
Pleasant words are flowing honey,
There is a path that may seem straight to someone,
The appetite of workers labors for them,
Worthless people dig up trouble;
Destructive people produce conflict;
Violent people entice their neighbors
Those who wink their eye plot destruction;
Gray hair is a crown of glory;
Better to be patient than a warrior,
The dice are cast into the lap;

17.verse_text: Better a dry crust with quiet than a house full of feasting with quarrels. and will divide an inheritance with the brothers. but the LORD tests the heart. a liar listens to a destructive tongue. those who rejoice in disaster won"t go unpunished. and the glory of children is their parents. even less so false speech for an honorable person. granting success to all who use it. but one who repeats it divides friends. than a hundred lashes to a fool. a cruel messenger will be sent against them. than fools in their folly. of those who return evil for good. so drop the dispute before it breaks out. the LORD detests both of these. to pay for wisdom? He has no mind. and kinsfolk are born for times of trouble. securing a loan for a friend. those who build a high doorway invite a collapse. and those with twisted tongues will fall into trouble. there"s no joy for a scoundrel"s father. but a broken spirit dries up the bones. to twist the way of justice. but the eyes of fools are off to the edges of the earth. and bitter to her who gave birth to him. to strike the honorable for their integrity. people with understanding are coolheaded. those who shut their lips are smart.
An insightful servant rules over a disgraceful son
A crucible is for silver and a furnace for gold,
An evildoer pays attention to guilty lips;
Those who mock the poor insult their maker;
Grandchildren are the crown of the elderly,
Too much talking isn"t right for a fool;
A bribe seems magical in the eyes of those who give it,
One who seeks love conceals an offense,
A rebuke goes deeper to an understanding person
Evil people seek only rebellion;
Safer to meet a bear robbed of her cubs
Evil will never depart from the house
The start of a quarrel is like letting out water,
Judging the righteous wicked and the wicked righteous–
Why should a fool have money
Friends love all the time,
One with no sense shakes hands on a deal,
Those who love an offense love a quarrel;
Those with crooked hearts won"t prosper,
Having a fool for a son brings grief;
A joyful heart helps healing,
The wicked take secret bribes
Wisdom is right in front of those with understanding,
A foolish son is irritating to his father
It isn"t good to punish the righteous,
Wise are those who restrain their talking;
Fools who keep quiet are deemed wise;

18.verse_text: Unfriendly people look out for themselves; they bicker with sensible people. but only in expressing their opinion. with shame comes insult. a bubbling stream, a fountain of wisdom. it denies justice to the righteous. their mouths elicit beatings. their lips are a trap for their lives. they go down to the inmost parts. are brothers to thugs. the righteous run to it and find refuge. and like a high wall in their imagination. but humility comes before respect. are foolish and disgraceful. but who can bear a broken spirit? the ear of the wise seeks knowledge. for access to important people. until the other comes and cross-examines him. and keep strong opponents apart. such quarreling is like the bars of a castle. by the fruit of the mouth; one"s lips can earn a satisfying income. those who love it will eat its fruit. gaining favor from the LORD . but the wealthy answer harshly. but then there are friends who are more loyal than family.
Fools find no pleasure in understanding,
When the wicked arrive, so does contempt;
The words of a person"s mouth are deep waters,
Favoring the wicked isn"t good;
The lips of fools make accusations;
The mouth of fools is their ruin;
The words of gossips are like choice snacks;
Those who are lazy in their work
The LORD "s name is a strong tower;
The riches of the wealthy are a strong city
Pride comes before a disaster,
Those who answer before they listen
The human spirit sustains a sick person,
An understanding mind gains knowledge;
A gift opens the way
The first person to testify seems innocent,
The dice settle conflicts
An offended ally is more formidable than a city;
The stomach is satisfied
Death and life are in the power of the tongue;
He who finds a wife finds what is good,
The poor plead for help,
There are persons for companionship,

19.verse_text: Better to be poor and walk in innocence than to have dishonest lips and be a fool. rushing feet make mistakes. but their hearts rage against the LORD . but the poor lose their friends. and a liar won"t escape. everyone befriends a gift giver. even more, their friends stay far from them. When they pursue them with words, they aren"t there. those who keep understanding find success. and liars will perish. even less so for a servant to rule over princes. their glory is to ignore an offense. his favor is like the dew on the grass. a contentious wife is like constant dripping. but an insightful wife is from the LORD . a slacker goes hungry. those who disregard their ways will die. and the Lord will fully repay them. but don"t plan to kill them. if you rescue them, then you will have to do it again. so you might grow wise in the future. but the LORD "s purpose will succeed. it is better to be poor than a liar. then one rests content, untouched by harm. they won"t even put it to their mouth. correct someone with understanding, and they will gain knowledge. are disgraceful children, worthy of reproach. you will wander away from words of knowledge. the wicked mouth gulps down trouble. and blows for the backs of fools.
Ignorant desire isn"t good;
People"s own folly corrupts their way,
Riches increase one"s friends,
A false witness won"t go unpunished,
Many seek favor from rulers;
All the relatives of the poor hate them;
Those who acquire good sense love themselves;
False witnesses won"t go unpunished,
Luxury isn"t fitting for a fool;
Insightful people restrain their anger;
A raging king roars like a lion;
A foolish son is a disaster to his father;
House and riches are an inheritance from one"s ancestors,
Laziness brings on deep sleep;
Those who keep the commandment preserve their lives;
Those who are gracious to the poor lend to the LORD ,
Discipline your children while there is hope,
Angry people must pay the penalty;
Listen to advice and accept instruction,
Many plans are in a person"s mind,
People long for trustworthiness;
The fear of the LORD leads to life;
Lazy people bury their hand in the bowl;
Strike someone who scoffs, and a naive person will become clever;
Those who assault their father and drive out their mother
If, my child, you stop listening to discipline,
A worthless witness mocks justice;
Punishments were made for mockers,

20.verse_text: Wine is a mocker; beer a carouser. Those it leads astray won"t become wise. Those who anger him may lose their life. but fools jump right in. at harvest they look but find nothing. those with understanding can draw it out. but who can find a reliable person? happy are their children who come after them. sifts out all evil with his eyes. I"m cleansed from my sin'? the LORD detests them both. whether their conduct is pure and upright. the LORD made them both. stay alert and you will have plenty to eat. but then goes away and brags. but wise speech is the most precious jewel. take his pledge for a foreigner. but afterward the mouth is full of gravel. wage wars with good guidance. don"t associate with those who talk too much. their lamp will be snuffed out when it becomes dark. won"t bless later on. Wait for the LORD , and he will save you. deceptive scales aren"t right. how then can people understand their path? and only reflect after making the promise. and runs them over with a wheel. searching all the inmost parts. he supports his throne by kindness. gray hair is the splendor of old age. beatings cleanse the inner parts.
A king is as terrifying as a lion"s growl.
It is honorable to back off from a fight,
The lazy don"t plow during winter;
Advice comes from the deep waters of the heart;
Many people will say that they are loyal,
The righteous live with integrity;
A king who sits on his judgment throne
Who can say, 'I"m innocent to the core;
False weights and measures–
Even young people are known by their actions,
Ears to hear and eyes to see–
Don"t love sleep or you will be poor;
The buyer says, 'Bad, bad,'
Much gold and many pearls exist,
Take the garment of the person who secures a loan for a stranger;
Stolen bread is sweet,
Plans are firmed up by advice;
Gossips reveal secrets;
Those who curse their father or mother–
Inheritance gained quickly at first
Don"t say, 'I"ll repay the evildoer!'
The LORD detests false weights;
A person"s steps are from the LORD ;
It is a snare to say rashly, 'It is holy,'
A wise king sifts out the wicked,
The breath of a person is the lamp of the LORD ,
Kindness and faithfulness protect the king;
Strength is the glory of young men;
Blows and bruises remove evil;

21.verse_text: The king"s heart is like channels of water in the hand of the LORD ; he directs it wherever he wants. but the LORD weighs the heart. is more valued by the LORD than sacrifice. the lamp of the wicked are all sinful. but those who hurry end up with loss. are like a drifting fog, leading to death. for they refuse to act with justice. but the behavior of those who do right is pure. than with a contentious woman in a large house. their neighbors receive no mercy from them. when insight comes to the wise, knowledge increases. turning the wicked toward trouble. will themselves call out but receive no answer. but dreaded by those who do evil. will rest in the company of the dead. lovers of wine and oil won"t get rich. than in a house with a contentious and angry woman. but fools swallow them up. will find life, righteousness, and honor. and brought down the stronghold in which they felt safe. guard themselves from trouble. Their conduct involves excessive pride. because their hands refuse to do anything. but the righteous give without holding back. especially when brought with devious motives. but one who listens will testify successfully. but the virtuous think about the path ahead. or advice can stand up against the LORD . but victory belongs to the LORD .
Everyone"s path is straight in their own eyes,
Acting with righteousness and justice
Prideful eyes, an arrogant heart, and
The plans of the diligent end up in profit,
Those who gain treasure with lies
The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,
The ways of some people are twisted and strange,
Better to live on the edge of a roof
Wicked people desire evil;
When a mocker is punished, the naive person gains wisdom;
The righteous one observes the house of the wicked,
Those who close their ears to the cries of the poor
A secret gift calms anger, and a hidden bribe removes furious wrath. the treacherous will be punished in the place of the virtuous.
Acting justly is a joy to the righteous,
People who wander from the path of insight
Those who love pleasure end up poor;
The wicked are a ransom for the righteous;
Better to live in a wilderness
Precious treasure and oil stay in the home of the wise,
Those who pursue righteousness and kindness
A wise person fought a city of warriors
Those who guard their mouths and their tongues
Incredibly proud–mockers are their name!
The desires of the lazy will kill them,
The lazy desire things constantly,
The LORD detests the sacrifices of the wicked,
A lying witness will perish,
The wicked person appears brash,
No wisdom, understanding,
A horse is made ready for the day of battle,

22.verse_text: A good reputation is better than much wealth; high esteem is better than silver and gold. the LORD made them both. while the simpleminded go right to it and get punished. is wealth, honor, and life. those who guard their lives keep their distance. when they grow old, they won"t depart from it. a borrower is a slave to a lender. the rod of their fury will come to an end. because they give some of their food to the poor. judgment and shame also stop. their speech is gracious, and the king is their friend. but he frustrates the words of the treacherous. I"ll be killed in the town square!' those under the LORD "s wrath will fall in it. the rod of discipline removes it. and giving to the wealthy lead only to poverty. focus your mind on my knowledge. if you have them ready on your lips. I"m teaching you today–yes, you. full of advice and knowledge? so you can report back reliably to those who sent you. Don"t oppress the needy in the gate. don"t associate with hot-tempered people; and become trapped. why should they be able to take your bed from you? that your ancestors established. They will work for kings but not work for lowly people.
The rich and the poor have this in common:
Prudent people see trouble and hide,
The reward of humility and the fear of the LORD
Thorns and nets are in the path of the crooked;
Train children in the way they should go;
The wealthy rule over the poor;
Those who sow injustice will harvest evil;
Happy are generous people,
Remove the mocker and conflict disappears;
Those who love a pure heart–
The LORD "s eyes protect knowledge,
A lazy person says, 'There"s a lion in the street!
The mouth of a mysterious woman is a deep pit;
Folly is bound up in a child"s heart;
Oppressing the poor to get rich
Turn your ear and hear the words of the wise;
It will be pleasant if you keep the words in you,
So that your trust will be in the LORD ,
Haven"t I written for you thirty sayings
Their purpose is to teach you true, reliable words,
Don"t steal from the poor, because they are poor.
The LORD will take up their case and press the life out of those who oppress them.
Don"t befriend people controlled by anger;
otherwise, you will learn their ways
Don"t shake hands to guarantee a loan.
If you can"t repay,
Don"t remove an ancient boundary marker
Do you see people who work skillfully?

23.verse_text: When you sit down to dine with a ruler, carefully consider what is in front of you. to control your appetite. the food misleads. be smart enough to stop. it is gone; it grows wings like an eagle and flies heavenward. don"t long for their delicacies, They say to you, 'Eat and drink!' but they don"t mean it. You will waste your pleasant words. for they will scorn your insightful words. don"t invade the fields of orphans, He will bring charges against you. your ear to knowledgeable sayings. if you strike them with a rod, they won"t die. then my heart too will be happy. when your lips speak with integrity. but fear the LORD constantly; and your hope won"t be cut off. Keep your mind straight on the path. or those who eat too much meat, their stupor will clothe them in rags. don"t despise your elderly mother. buy wisdom, instruction, and understanding. the one who gives life to the wise will rejoice. she who gave you birth will be happy. and let your eyes keep to my path. and a foreign woman is a narrow well. and increases the number of the faithless. Who is uneasy? Who has arguments? Who has complaints? Who has unnecessary wounds? Who has glazed eyes?– those who go looking for mixed wine. when it sparkles in the cup, going down smoothly. and poisons like a viper. and your heart will speak distorted words. or one who lies on top of a mast. though beaten up, I don"t know anything about it. When I wake up, I"ll look for wine again!'
Place a knife at your throat
Don"t long for the ruler"s delicacies;
Don"t wear yourself out trying to get rich;
When your eyes fly to wealth
Don"t eat food with stingy people;
because they are like a hair in the throat.
You will eat scraps and vomit them out.
Don"t speak in the ears of fools,
Don"t remove an ancient boundary marker;
for their redeemer is strong.
Bring your mind to instruction,
Don"t withhold instruction from children;
Strike them with a rod, and you will save their lives from the grave.
My child, if your heart is wise,
My inner being will rejoice
Don"t let your heart envy sinners,
then you will have a future,
Listen, my child, and be wise!
Don"t hang out with those who get drunk on wine
because drunks and gluttons will be impoverished;
Listen to your father, who gave you life;
Buy truth and don"t sell it;
The father of the righteous will be very happy;
Your father and your mother will rejoice;
My child, give your mind to me
A prostitute is a deep pit,
Indeed, she ambushes like a robber
Who is suffering?
those who linger over wine;
Don"t look at wine when it is red,
In the end, it bites like a snake
Your eyes will see strange things,
You will be like one who lies down while out on the sea
'Though hit, I feel no pain;

24.verse_text: Don"t envy evil people, and don"t long to be with them. and their lips speak of trouble. by understanding it is established. with all precious and pleasant wealth. a knowledgeable person than a powerful one. victory comes with many counselors. They don"t open their mouths in the gate. will be called master schemers. people detest mockers. your strength is too small. and from those staggering to the slaughter, don"t hold back. the one who weighs hearts–doesn"t he understand? The one who protects your life–he knows. He makes people pay for their actions. The honeycomb is sweet in your mouth. If you find it, there is a future. Your hope won"t be cut off. Don"t destroy their dwelling. but the wicked will stumble into trouble. When they stumble, don"t let your heart be glad, and he will turn his anger from them. don"t be envious of the wicked. the lamp of the wicked will be put out. Don"t associate with those who are rebellious. Who can know the ruin that both can bring? Partiality in judgment isn"t good. the people will curse them. Nations will condemn them. A rich blessing will come to them. are like those who kiss on the lips. make preparations in the field; then you can build your house. don"t deceive with your lips. I"ll pay them back for their actions.' by the vineyard of one with no sense. weeds covered the ground, and the stone wall was falling down. I saw it and learned a lesson. a little lying down with folded arms'– deprivation like a man with a shield.
Their hearts are focused on violence,
By wisdom a house is built;
By knowledge rooms are filled
A wise person is mightier than a strong one;
You should make war with guidance;
Wisdom is beyond foolish people.
Those who plot evil
The scheming of fools is sin;
If you show yourself weak on a day of distress,
Rescue those being taken off to death;
If you say, 'Look, we didn"t know about it,'
My child, eat honey, for it is good.
Know that wisdom is like that for your whole being.
Wicked one, don"t wait secretly at the home of the righteous.
The righteous may fall seven times but still get up,
When your enemies fall, don"t rejoice.
or the LORD will see it and be displeased,
Don"t get fighting mad at evil people;
Indeed, there is no future for the evil;
Fear the LORD , my child, as well as the king.
Disaster comes suddenly from them.
These are also the sayings of the wise:
Those who say to the guilty, 'You are innocent'–
But it will go well for those who rebuke them.
Those who speak honestly
Get your outside work done;
Don"t be a witness against your neighbor without reason;
Don"t say, 'I"ll do to them what they did to me.
I happened upon the field of a lazy person,
Thorns grew all over it;
I observed this and took it to heart;
'A little sleep, a little slumber,
and poverty will come on you like a prowler,

25.verse_text: These are also proverbs of Solomon, copied by the men of Hezekiah, king of Judah: and the glory of kings to discover something. so the mind of a king is unsearchable. and a vessel will come out for the refiner. and his throne will be established in righteousness. or stand in the place of important people, 'Come up here,' than to be demoted before a ruler. What your eyes see, what will you do in the future when your neighbor shames you? and don"t give away someone"s secret. the slander against you will never stop. are like gold apples in a silver setting. is like a gold earring or jewelry of fine gold. are reliable messengers to those who send them; they restore the life of their master. are like clouds and wind that produce no rain. and a tender tongue can break a bone. otherwise, you"ll get full and vomit it up. Otherwise, they"ll get fed up with you and hate you. are like a club, sword, and sharpened arrow. is like having a bad tooth or a wobbly foot. is like taking off a garment on a cold day if they are thirsty, give them water to drink. and the LORD will reward you. and a person who plots quietly provokes angry faces. than to share a house with a contentious woman. is like cold water for a weary person. is like a contaminated spring or a polluted fountain. nor is it appropriate to seek honor. is like a breached city, one with no walls.
It is the glory of God to hide something
Like the high heavens and the depths of the earth,
Remove the dross from the silver,
Remove the wicked from the king"s presence,
Don"t exalt yourself in the presence of the king,
because it is better that he say to you,
don"t be quick to quarrel over;
Argue it out with your neighbor,
Otherwise, the one who hears it will vilify you;
Words spoken at the right time
Wise correction to an ear that listens
Like the coolness of snow on a harvest day
People who brag about a gift never given
A commander can be persuaded with patience,
If you find honey, eat just the right amount;
Don"t spend too much time in your neighbor"s house.
People who testify falsely against their neighbors
Trusting a treacherous person at a difficult time
Singing a song to a troubled heart or putting vinegar on a wound.
If your enemies are starving, feed them some bread;
By doing this, you will heap burning coals on their heads,
The north wind stirs up rain,
Better to live on the edge of a roof
Good news from a distant land
A righteous person giving in to the wicked
Eating too much honey isn"t good,
A person without self-control

26.verse_text: Like snow in the summer or rain at harvest, so honor isn"t appropriate for a fool. so an undeserved curse never arrives. and a rod for the back of fools. or you will become like them yourself. or they will deem themselves wise. is like cutting off one"s feet or drinking down violence. so does a proverb in the mouth of fools. so is giving respect to a fool. so is a proverb in the mouth of fools. so is one who hires a fool or a passerby. so a fool repeats foolish mistakes. There is more hope for a fool than for them. A lion in the plazas!' so do lazy people in their beds. too tired to return it to their mouth. than seven people who answer sensibly. so is one who passes by and gets involved in another person"s fight. without gossips, conflict calms down. quarrelsome people kindle strife. they go down to the inmost parts. are like silver coating on clay. keeping their deception within. for seven horrible things are in their heart. but their evil will be revealed in public. those who roll a stone will have it turn back on them. a flattering mouth causes destruction.
Like a darting sparrow, like a flying swallow,
A whip for a horse, a bridle for a donkey,
Don"t answer fools according to their folly,
Answer fools according to their folly,
Sending messages with a fool
As legs dangle from a disabled person,
Like tying a stone in a sling,
Like a thorny bush in the hand of a drunk,
Like an archer who wounds someone randomly,
Like a dog that returns to its vomit,
Do you see people who consider themselves wise?
A lazy person says, 'There"s a lion in the path!
As a door turns on its hinge,
Lazy people bury their hand into the bowl,
Lazy people think they are wiser
Like yanking the ears of a dog,
Like a crazy person shooting deadly flaming arrows
are those who deceive their neighbor and say, 'Hey, I was only joking!'
Without wood a fire goes out;
Like adding charcoal to embers or wood to fire,
The words of gossips are like choice snacks;
Smooth lips and an evil heart
Hateful people mislead with their lips,
Though they speak graciously, don"t believe them,
They may cover their hatred with trickery,
Those who dig a pit will fall in it;
A lying tongue hates those it crushes;

27.verse_text: Don"t brag about tomorrow, for you don"t know what a day will bring. a stranger, and not your own lips. but the nuisance of fools is heavier than both. but who can withstand jealousy? excessive are the kisses of an enemy. but anything bitter tastes sweet to a hungry person. so is one who wanders from home. don"t go to your relative"s house when disaster strikes. Better a neighbor nearby than a relative far away. so I can answer those who insult me. the simpleminded go right to it and get punished. take his pledge for a foreigner. will be viewed as a curse. and a contentious woman are alike; can control the wind or pick up oil in his hand. so one person sharpens a friend. and those who look after their master will be honored. so the heart reflects one person to another. and people"s eyes are never satisfied. so are people in the presence of someone who praises them. even grinding them along with the grain, their folly won"t be driven from them. pay attention to your herds, nor a crown generation after generation. and the plants of the hills are gathered, and the goats will be the price of your fields. for the food of your house, and to nourish your young women.
Let another person praise you, and not your own mouth;
A stone is heavy and sand weighs much,
Wrath is cruel and anger is a flood,
A public correction is better than hidden love.
Trustworthy are the bruises of a friend;
Someone who is full refuses honey,
Like a bird wandering from its nest,
Oil and incense make the heart glad, and the sweetness of friends comes from their advice.
Don"t desert your friend or a friend of your family;
Be wise, my child, and make my heart glad,
Prudent people see evil and hide;
Take the garment of the person who secures a loan for a stranger;
Greeting a neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning
The constant dripping on a rainy day
anyone who can control her
As iron sharpens iron,
Those who tend a fig tree will eat its fruit,
As water reflects the face,
The grave and the underworld are never satisfied;
A crucible is for silver and a furnace for gold;
Even if you grind fools in a mortar,
Know your flock well;
for no treasure lasts forever,
When the grass goes away, new growth appears,
then the lambs will provide your clothes,
There will be enough goat"s milk for your food,

28.verse_text: The wicked run away even though no one pursues them, but the righteous are as confident as a lion. but a person with understanding brings order. are rain that washes away food. but those who follow Instruction battle them. but those who seek the LORD understand everything. than to be on crooked paths and wealthy. but those who befriend gluttons shame their parents. gather money for those who are generous to the poor. even their prayers will be detested. will fall into their own pit, but the blameless will inherit good things. but an insightful poor person sees through them. but people hide when the wicked prosper. but those who confess and give them up will receive mercy. but those whose hearts are hard fall into trouble. is like a growling lion or a prowling bear. but one who hates unjust gain will live long. don"t hold them back from fleeing to the pit. but those who go on twisted paths will fall into the grave. but those with worthless pursuits will have plenty of poverty. but those with get-rich-quick schemes won"t go unpunished. people do wrong for a crust of bread. unaware that loss will come to them. than those with flattering tongues. and say, 'It"s not a crime,' are friends of vandals. but those who trust the LORD become prosperous. but those who walk in wisdom will be kept safe. but those who turn a blind eye will be greatly cursed. but when they are destroyed, the righteous multiply.
When a land rebels, there are many leaders;
Poor people who oppress the needy
Those who abandon Instruction praise the wicked,
Evil people don"t understand justice,
Better to be poor and walk in innocence
Intelligent children follow Instruction,
Those who become rich through high interest rates
Those who turn their ears from hearing Instruction–
Whoever misleads those who do right onto an evil path
Rich people think they are wise,
When the righteous rejoice, there is great respect,
Those who hide their sins won"t succeed,
Happy are those who are continually fearful,
A wicked ruler over the poor
A prince without understanding is a cruel oppressor,
If someone feels guilty about murder,
Those who walk in innocence will be saved,
Those who work the land will have plenty to eat,
Reliable people will have abundant blessings,
Those who show favoritism aren"t good;
The stingy try to get rich fast,
Those who correct someone will, in the end, find more favor
Those who steal from their father and mother,
Greedy people stir up conflict,
Those who trust in their own reasoning are fools,
Those who give to the poor will lack nothing,
When the wicked rise up, people hide,

29.verse_text: One who stays stubborn after many corrections will be suddenly broken, beyond healing. but when the wicked dominate, the people moan. but one who spends time with prostitutes destroys riches. but one who imposes heavy taxes tears it down. spread out a net for their feet. the righteous sing and rejoice. but the wicked don"t understand. but the wise turn back anger. the fools shout, they laugh–there is no calm. and they seek the lives of the virtuous. but the wise hold it back. those who serve him will be wicked. the LORD gives light to the eyes of both. his throne will be established forever. but children out of control shame their mothers. the righteous will see their downfall. and bring delight into your life. but whoever obeys instruction is happy. they might understand, but they don"t respond. There is more hope for fools than for them. and later on there will be trouble. hotheads cause much offense. but those of humble spirit gain honor. even under oath, they don"t testify. those who trust the LORD are secure. but justice comes from the LORD . the straight path is disgusting to the wicked.
When the righteous become numerous, the people rejoice,
A man who loves wisdom makes his father rejoice,
A king gives stability to the land by justice,
People who flatter their friends
The wicked are snared by their own sin;
The righteous know the rights of the poor,
Mockers set a city on fire,
When the wise make a legal charge against the foolish,
Murderous people hate the innocent,
Fools show all their anger,
If a ruler listens to lies,
The poor and their oppressors have a common bond–
If a king judges the poor honestly,
The rod and correction lead to wisdom,
When the wicked become numerous, so do crimes;
Instruct your children; they will give you peace of mind
When there"s no vision, the people get out of control,
Servants aren"t disciplined by words;
Do you see people who are quick to speak?
Pamper servants from a young age,
Angry people stir up conflict;
Pride lays people low,
Those who share plunder with thieves hate themselves;
People are trapped by their fear of others;
Many seek access to the ruler,
The unjust person is disgusting to the righteous;

30.verse_text: The words of Agur, Jakeh"s son, from Massa. The man declares: I"m tired, God; I"m tired, God, and I"m exhausted. a man without understanding. nor do I have knowledge of the holy one. Who has gathered the wind by the handful? Who has bound up the waters in a garment? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is this person"s name and the name of this person"s child– if you know it? a shield for those who take refuge in him. or he will correct you and show you to be a liar. don"t keep them from me before I die: keep far from me! Don"t give me either poverty or wealth; give me just the food I need. and say, 'Who is the LORD ?' Or I"ll be poor and steal, and dishonor my God"s name. otherwise, the servant will curse you, and you will be guilty. and don"t bless their mother. but haven"t washed off their own excrement. how arrogant are their eyes; how their eyebrows are raised! their jaw is a butcher"s knife, ready to devour the needy from the earth, and the poor from humanity. There are three things that are never satisfied, four that never say, 'Enough!': a land never filled with water, and fire that doesn"t say, 'Enough!' and rejects obedience to a mother, may the ravens of the river valley peck it out, and the eagle"s young eat it. four that I can"t figure out: the way of a snake on the rock, the way of a ship out on the open sea, and the way of a man with a young woman. she eats and wipes her mouth, and she says, 'I"ve done nothing wrong!' at four it can"t bear up: and fools when they are full of food; and a female servant when she replaces her mistress. but they are extremely wise: but they store away their food in the summer. but they make their homes in the rocks. but they march together in ranks. but they are in kings" palaces. four that are excellent as they walk: which doesn"t back down at anything; and a king with his army. if you"ve been scheming, put your hand to your mouth, squeezing the nose brings blood, and stirring up anger produces strife.
Actually, I"m too stupid to be human,
I haven"t learned wisdom,
Who has gone up to heaven and come down?
All God"s words are tried and true;
Don"t add to his words,
Two things I ask of you;
Fraud and lies–
Or I"ll be full and deny you,
Don"t slander a servant to his master;
There are those who curse their father
There are those who think they are clean,
There are those–
There are those whose teeth are swords;
The leech has two daughters: 'Give, give!'
the grave and a barren womb,
An eye that mocks a father
Three things are too wonderful for me,
the way of an eagle in the sky,
This is the way of an adulterous woman:
At three things the earth trembles,
at a servant when he becomes king
at a detested woman when she gets married
Four things are among the smallest on earth,
Ants as creatures aren"t strong,
Badgers as creatures aren"t powerful,
Locusts don"t have a king,
You can catch lizards in your hand,
There are three things that are excellent in their stride,
a lion, a warrior among beasts,
the strut of a rooster or a male goat;
If you"ve been foolish and arrogant,
because churning milk makes curds,

31.verse_text: The words of King Lemuel of Massa, which his mother taught him: No, son of my womb! No, son of my solemn promises! your ways to those who wipe out kings. it isn"t for kings to drink wine, and violate the rights of the needy. and wine to those whose hearts are bitter. and no longer remember their toil. and to defend the needy and the poor. Her value is far above pearls. and with her he will have all he needs. all the days of her life. she works joyfully with her hands. bringing food from a distance. providing food for her household, even some for her female servants. from her own resources, she plants a vineyard. her arms are powerful. she doesn"t put out her lamp at night. her palms grasp the whorl. she stretches out her hands to the poor. fine linen and purple are her clothing. when he sits with the elders of the land. she supplies sashes to traders. she is confident about the future. kindly teaching is on her tongue. she doesn"t eat the food of laziness. her husband praises her: but you surpass them all!' but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised. let her deeds praise her in the city gates.
No, my son!
Don"t give your strength to women,
It isn"t for kings, Lemuel, for rulers to crave strong drink. and for the rights of all who are vulnerable. because they are all dressed in warm clothes.
Otherwise, they will drink and forget the law,
Give strong drink to those who are perishing
Let them drink and forget their poverty
Speak out on behalf of the voiceless,
Speak out in order to judge with righteousness
A competent wife, how does one find her?
Her husband entrusts his heart to her,
She brings him good and not trouble
She seeks out wool and flax;
She is like a fleet of merchant ships,
She gets up while it is still night,
She surveys a field and acquires it;
She works energetically;
She realizes that her trading is successful;
She puts her hands to the spindle;
She reaches out to the needy;
She doesn"t fear for her household when it snows,
She makes bedspreads for herself;
Her husband is known in the city gates
She makes garments and sells them;
Strength and honor are her clothing;
Her mouth is full of wisdom;
She is vigilant over the activities of her household;
Her children bless her;
'Many women act competently,
Charm is deceptive and beauty fleeting,
Let her share in the results of her work;
